description:
Close and save open windows. And restore them. Most importantly, it supports both X11 and Wayland!

Main features:
- Close open windows
- Close apps with multiple windows via `ydotool` so you don't lose sessions of this app. Please see https://github.com/nlpsuge/gnome-shell-extension-another-window-session-manager#how-to-restore-a-session-at-startup to learn how to make `Close by rules` work
- Save open windows
- Restore session(s)
- Restore a session at startup. Please note that this feature is disabled by default. See https://github.com/nlpsuge/gnome-shell-extension-another-window-session-manager#how-to-restore-a-session-at-startup to learn how to enable and use it
- Restore window state, including Always on Top,  Always on Visible Workspace and maximization
- Restore window workspace, size and position
- Move windows to their own workspace according to a saved session
- Support multi-monitor
- Trash saved session
- Search saved session by the session name fuzzily
name: Another Window Session Manager
